SEARCH
Package gw.api.outboundfile

Class BaseOutboundZippedFileHandler

java.lang.Object
gw.api.outboundfile.BaseOutboundZippedFileHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
OutboundFileHandler, Closeable, AutoCloseable
public class BaseOutboundZippedFileHandler extends Object implements OutboundFileHandler
This is a base class for OutboundFileHandler, that zips the content, the open and the close should normally just be used and writer(WriterBlock) can be used to access the writer for that file.

IMPLEMENTATION NOTE: There are two constructors the first, BaseOutboundZippedFileHandler(OutboundFileConfig, String, String, String) takes an entryName as a string (the 2nd arg) and will write all records into the that entry in the zip file, it can also write the header and footer string passed to that constructor. The other, BaseOutboundZippedFileHandler(OutboundFileConfig,java.util.function.Function) will call that method for each OutboundRecord and create an entry for each.

    • BaseOutboundZippedFileHandler

      public BaseOutboundZippedFileHandler(@NotNull @NotNull OutboundFileConfig config, @NotNull @NotNull Function<OutboundRecord,String> entryNameLambda)
      The constructor called by the batch process, com.guidewire.outboundfile.batch.OutboundFileBatchProcess

      IMPLEMENTORS NOTE: Subclasses must implement this constructor and may either call this or BaseOutboundZippedFileHandler(OutboundFileConfig, String, String, String)

      Parameters:
      config - the configuration file, it will never be null
      entryNameLambda - a function to return a unique name for an entry based OutboundRecord

    • BaseOutboundZippedFileHandler

      Parameters:
      config - the configuration file, it will never be null
      entryName - a single entry is created in the zip file

  • Method Details

    • writer

      protected void writer(BaseOutboundZippedFileHandler.WriterBlock block)
      Access the writer, once it is created in the open(String, IntentionalLogger, Marker) This will wrap any IOException as WrapperException

      IMPLEMENTORS NOTE: This will throw an exception if called without having called open, but that will not happen in the batch process. Example: 

      
    writer(\w -> {w.write(record.Content); w.newLine()});
      Parameters:
      block - what to do with the writer

    • getConfig

      protected OutboundFileConfig getConfig()
      The config, passed in the constructor
      Returns:
      the config

    • open

      public void open(String zipFilePath, IntentionalLogger logger, org.slf4j.Marker marker)
      This will open the temp file and write any supplied header. Note that the configuration should have the Extension OutboundFileConfig.getExtension() should be set to "zip"

      IMPLEMENTORS NOTE: normally you would not override. This populates the writer which is called by writer(WriterBlock) used in process(OutboundRecord, IntentionalLogger, Marker)

      Specified by:
      open in interface OutboundFileHandler
      Parameters:
      zipFilePath - a filename name, always provided
      logger - a logger to use for any messages, always provided
      marker - the markers for the logger, always provided
      Throws:
      WrapperException - on IOExceptions

    • process

      public void process(OutboundRecord record, IntentionalLogger logger, org.slf4j.Marker marker)
      This will write the record
      Specified by:
      process in interface OutboundFileHandler
      Parameters:
      record - the record to write, always provided
      logger - a logger for any message, always provided
      marker - the marker for the logger, always provided

      IMPLEMENTORS NOTE: You normally want to override this method without calling the super 

      
    function process(record : OutboundRecord, logger : IntentionalLogger, marker : Marker) {
      writer(\w -> {w.write(record.Content); w.newLine()})
    }
      Throws:
      WrapperException - on IOExceptions
      OutboundFileProcessingException - if the record is invalid and should be discarded
